about_armenia_text: Nestled in the heart of the Caucasus, Armenia is a country where history, nature, and culture come together in a mesmerizing blend. As one of the world’s oldest civilizations, Armenia offers travelers a unique journey through time, from prehistoric sites to medieval monasteries, all set against a backdrop of stunning landscapes.

media.title: The Cradle of Christianity
media.text: Armenia was the first nation to adopt Christianity as its state religion in 301 AD, and its spiritual heritage is evident in its many ancient churches and monasteries. Landmarks like Etchmiadzin Cathedral,Tatev Monastery, and Geghard Monastery stand as breathtaking symbols of faith and resilience.

media.title: Nature’s Masterpiece
media.text: Beyond its historical wonders, Armenia is a paradise for nature lovers. The majestic Mount Ararat, the serene Lake Sevan, the lush forests of Dilijan, and the rugged landscapes of Noravank Canyon create a spectacular tapestry of natural beauty. Whether you seek adventure or tranquility, Armenia’s diverse landscapes offer something for everyone.

media.title: A Rich and Unique Culture
media.text: Armenia’s culture is a vibrant mix of traditions, arts, and hospitality. Experience the soulful sounds of duduk music, witness the artistry of khachkars (cross-stones), and immerse yourself in the warmth of Armenian hospitality. Our people take pride in sharing their customs, making every visitor feel at home.

media.title: Culinary Delights
media.text: Armenian cuisine is a feast for the senses. From the flavorful khorovats (barbecue) to the delicate layers of lavash bread, every dish tells a story of tradition and love. Don’t miss the opportunity to taste Areni wine, made from grapes cultivated for over 6,000 years.

who_we_are.sub_text:
We are a passionate team of tourism professionals with over 20 years of combined experience, dedicated to sharing the beauty, history, and hidden treasures of Armenia. We decided to create Visit Armina to turn our “crazy ideas” into unforgettable travel experiences, offering something truly unique for every traveler.

Our company may be new, but our deep knowledge of Armenia and the region is built on years of expertise. Whether you’re looking for a relaxing cultural escape or an adventurous journey, we’ve got you covered.
who_we_are.text:
The name Armina has deep roots in history—used in the 6th century BC by Darius the Great in the Behistun Inscription to refer to the ancient Armenian kingdom, a once-great empire full of culture, traditions, and legends.

At Visit Armina, we believe in making every experience feel personal and special.

Our logo reflects our commitment to warmth, safety, and the beauty of Armenia:
  • Apricot: The warmth of sunny Armenia and the welcoming, open-hearted nature of its people. The apricot is a symbol of Armenia, known for its rich history of apricot cultivation.
  • Green: The lush, scenic landscapes, perfect for trekking, hiking, and exploring.
  • Blue: Safety and trust—your well-being is our top priority as you explore Armenia with us.

What sets Armenia apart from other destinations like Italy or Spain? The warmth of its people, the charm of its ancient cities, the peace of its untouched nature, and the incredible food. At Visit Armina, we’ll help you experience all of this—and more.
who_we_are.visit_armina: “Visit Armina” – Expand Your Empire! And feel an Imperator for a moment for the land of the Sun, Mountains and Open-hearted people!

useful_information.title: Planning a trip to Armenia? Here’s everything you need to know before you go!
useful_information.geography:
1. Geography & Climate

  • Armenia is a landlocked country in the South Caucasus, bordering Georgia, Azerbaijan, Iran, and Turkey.
  • The country is mountainous, with stunning landscapes featuring Gdeep gorges, lush forests, lakes, and high-altitude plateaus.
  • The highest peak is Mount Aragats (4,090 m), and the most famous is Mount Ararat, a national symbol.
  • Climate: Continental – hot summers, cold winters, and mild, beautiful spring and autumn seasons.
useful_information.visa:
2. Visa & Entry Requirements

  • Citizens of many countries can enter Armenia visa-free for up to 180 days.
  • Others can obtain an e-visa or visa on arrival .
  • Check visa requirements here.
useful_information.currency:
3. Currency & Payments

  • The official currency is the Armenian Dram (AMD).
  • ATMs are widely available, and credit cards are accepted in most places.
  • It’s best to carry some cash for small shops, taxis, and rural areas.
useful_information.language:
4. Language

  • The official language is Armenian, but Russian and English are widely spoken,especially in Yerevan and tourist areas.
  • Learning a few Armenian phrases, like "Barev dzez" (Hello) and "Shnorhakalutyun" (Thank you), can enhance your experience!
useful_information.best_time:
5. Best Time to Visit

  • Spring (April–June): Lush landscapes and pleasant weather.
  • Summer (July–August): Great for festivals and outdoor activities, but can be hot.
  • Autumn (September–November): Stunning fall colors and perfect for wine tours.
  • Winter (December–February):Ideal for skiing inTsaghkadzor, My Ler and Jermuk
useful_information.transportation:
6. Transportation

  • Taxis & Rideshare: Apps likeGG, Yandex Go, and Bolt are reliable.
  • Public Transport:Buses and minibuses (marshrutkas) are affordable but can be crowded.
  • Car Rental:Driving is an excellent option for exploring Armenia, as the country is safe and easy for self-drive.Roads in major cities and highways are well-maintained, but rural areas can be challenging with narrow and winding roads. An international driver’s license is recommended.
useful_information.safety:
7. Safety & Health

  • Armenia is considered very safe for travellers, with low crime rates.
  • Tap water is safe to drink, and hospitals/pharmacies are well-equipped.
  • Travel insurance is recommended for medical emergencies and trip cancellations.
  • Emergency number: 911.
useful_information.food:
8. Food & Drinks

  • Must-try dishes: Khorovats (BBQ), Dolma, Harissa, and Gata.
  • Armenia is famous for wine and brandy – don’t miss a tasting tour!
  • Pulpulak – Armenia is known as"the land of free water", thanks to its numerous traditional public fresh drinking fountains found in every city and village.
useful_information.electrical_outlets:
9. Electrical Outlets

  • Voltage: 230V, 50Hz.
  • Plug type: European standard (Type C & F).
  • Time - GMT +4 hours
useful_information.tips:
10. Local Etiquette & Tips

  • Hospitality is key– Armenians are incredibly welcoming, and it’s common to be invited for coffee or even a meal.
  • Respect religious sites– Cover shoulders and knees when visiting churches and monasteries.
  • Tipping is appreciated but not mandatory (5-10% in restaurants).

contact.f_part: For any questions or assistance, feel free to
contact.l_part: We’re here to make your trip unforgettable!

must_to_see.title: Armenia, a land of ancient history and breathtaking landscapes, is home to countless must-visit sites. From awe-inspiring monasteries perched on cliffs to serene lakes and vibrant cities, here are the top places you should explore during your visit.

places.name: Yerevan – The Pink City
places.info:
The capital of Armenia, Yerevan, is one of the world's oldest continuously inhabited cities,dating back to 782 BC. Known for its pink tuff stone architecture, Yerevan is a vibrant mix of history, culture, and modern life.Must-See Spots:

  • Republic Square– The heart of the city with stunning architecture and musical fountains.
  • Cascade Complex– A giant stairway with breathtaking views and modern art installations.
  • Matenadaran– A museum housing ancient manuscripts.
  • Vernissage Market– A bustling open-air market with Armenian crafts and souvenirs.

places.name: Garni Temple & Geghard Monastery
places.info:
Located just outside Yerevan, these two sites offer a glimpse into Armenia’s ancient and medieval past. Must-See Spots:

  • Garni Temple– The only surviving Greco-Roman temple in the Caucasus (1st century AD).
  • Geghard Monastery– A UNESCO-listed medieval monastery partially carved into the rock.
  • Azat River Gorge– Known for its stunning basalt column formations, often called "Symphony of Stones."
  • Khosrov state reserve– Khosrov Reserve is a nature lover’s paradise with stunning landscapes, diverse wildlife, and ancient monasteries—perfect for hiking and eco-tourism!

places.name: Khor Virap Monastery
places.info: One of Armenia’s most iconic landmarks, Khor Virap offers stunning views of Mount Ararat and has deep historical significance as the site where St. Gregory the Illuminator was imprisoned before converting Armenia to Christianity.

places.name: Tatev Monastery & The Wings of Tatev
places.info: A masterpiece of medieval architecture, Tatev Monastery sits on the edge of a deep gorge and is one of Armenia’s most breathtaking destinations. Take the Wings of Tatev – the world’s longest reversible aerial tramway (5.7 km) – for a spectacular journey above the Vorotan Gorge and experience stunning panoramic views.

places.name: Noravank Monastery & Areni Wine Region
places.info: Surrounded by dramatic red rock cliffs , Noravank is one of the most picturesque monasteries in Armenia. Nearby, the Areni Wine Region is a must-visit for wine lovers, featuring the world’s oldest known winery (6,100 years old).

places.name: Lake Sevan & Sevanavank Monastery
places.info: One of the largest high-altitude lakes in the world, Lake Sevan is a perfect spot for relaxation and fresh seafood. The Sevanavank Monastery offers breathtaking panoramic views over the blue waters.

places.name: Dilijan National Park, Goshavank & Haghartsin Monasteries
places.info:
Nicknamed "Armenia’s Little Switzerland," Dilijan is a lush, green retreat with hiking trails, fresh mountain air, and beautifully restored monasteries. Must-See Spots:

  • Haghartsin Monastery– A hidden gem surrounded by dense forests.
  • Goshavank Monastery– Famous for its stunning medieval architecture and khachkars(cross-stones). The site is named after Mkhitar Gosh , a renowned scholar and statesman.
  • Dilijan National Park– A haven for nature lovers, offering diverse flora, fauna, and hiking opportunities.

places.name: Debed Canyon & Sanahin-Haghpat Monasteries
places.info: A UNESCO-listed treasure, these two medieval monasteries in northern Armenia are famous for their intricate stone carvings and stunning mountainous backdrop.

places.name: Jermuk – The Spa Resort
places.info: Famous for its mineral water springs and picturesque waterfall, Jermuk is Armenia’s top wellness destination, offering natural spa treatments and hot springs.

places.name: Khndzoresk Cave Village & Swinging Bridge
places.info: A hidden gem in southern Armenia, this abandoned cave village is connected by a suspension bridge that offers stunning views of the dramatic landscape.

places.name: Amberd and Aragats Mountain
places.info: Explore Amberd Medieval Fortress on the slopes of Mount Aragats, Armenia’s highest peak. Enjoy breathtaking views, unique volcanic landscapes, and scenic hiking trails—perfect for history and nature lovers.

places.name: Karahunj – The Armenian Stonehenge
places.info: Karahunj, often called the "Armenian Stonehenge," is an ancient megalithic site near Sisian. With large stones arranged in a circular pattern, it is believed to have been used for astronomical purposes over 5,000 years ago. A fascinating destination for history enthusiasts and those interested in ancient astronomy!

tour-description.title: Plan Your Armenian Adventure!
tour-description.text: Whether you're drawn to ancient monasteries, breathtaking landscapes, or delicious Armenian cuisine, these must-visit sites will give you a true taste of Armenia’s rich history and natural beauty. Book your tour today and start exploring!

our_tours.title: Discover Armenia with Our Unique Tours
our_tours.text: Armenia is a country of breathtaking landscapes, ancient history, and vibrant culture. Whether you are an adventurer, a history enthusiast, or a foodie, our carefully crafted tours offer something for everyone. Choose from our diverse selection and embark on an unforgettable journey!

types_of_tours.name: Regional Tours
types_of_tours.description: Explore Armenia and its neighboring countries with our regional tours that take you across Turkey, Armenia, Georgia, and Iran. Experience the cultural richness of the Caucasus and beyond as you journey through ancient cities, breathtaking landscapes, and diverse traditions. Walk through the historical streets of Tbilisi, marvel at the architectural wonders of Isfahan,explore the vibrant bazaars of Istanbul, and uncover the deep heritage of Yerevan. These cross-border trips provide a unique opportunity to explore the shared histories and distinct identities of these fascinating regions.

types_of_tours.name: Nature & Adventure Tours
types_of_tours.description:
For those who love the great outdoors, Armenia is a paradise of unspoiled nature. Hike through the stunning Tatev Gorge, trek the breathtaking peaks of Mount Aragats , or explore the picturesque waterfalls of Jermuk. In the northern part of Armenia, the Transcaucasus Trail is one of the most popular routes for hikers, offering awe-inspiring views of the Caucasus Mountains and passing through diverse landscapes.

For nature enthusiasts, bird watching tours offer a rare opportunity to observe the country’s diverse avian life. Armenia’s unique ecosystems, from forests and wetlands to high mountain regions, provide a home for over 300 bird species. Spots like Dilijan National Park, Lake Sevan, and the Khosrov Forest reserve are renowned for their birdlife, making them perfect destinations for bird watchers.

Botanical tours take you on a journey through Armenia’s rich flora. Armenia's varied landscapes—from temperate forests to alpine meadows—are home to a stunning array of plants and flowers. On these tours, you’ll visit nature reserves, national parks, and botanical gardens,such as the Dilijan Botanical Garden and Yerevan’s Botanic Garden, to discover endemic species, medicinal herbs, and wildflowers.

Our adventure tours also offer trekking, bicycle tours, and other outdoor activities in some of the most scenic spots, providing you with a chance to experience Armenia's diverse ecosystems from every angle.

types_of_tours.name: Historical & Archaeological Tours
types_of_tours.description: As one of the world’s oldest civilizations, Armenia is home to some of the most fascinating historical and archaeological sites. Walk among the ancient ruins of Zorats Karer (Armenia’s Stonehenge), explore the legendary Garni Temple, and visit the UNESCO-listed monasteries of Haghpat and Sanahin . These tours provide deep insight into Armenia’s millennia-old heritage.

types_of_tours.name: Wine & Gastronomy Tours
types_of_tours.description: Armenia is one of the oldest winemaking countries in the world, with a tradition dating back over 6,000 years. Our wine tours take you to the heart of Areni, where you can taste world-class wines and explore historic wineries. Indulge in authentic Armenian cuisine, from the famous khorovats (barbecue) to traditional lavash-making experiences.

types_of_tours.name: Cultural & Religious Tours
types_of_tours.description: Discover the soul of Armenia through its culture and spirituality. Visit the Mother See of Holy Etchmiadzin , the spiritual center of Armenian Christianity, or marvel at the intricate khachkars (cross-stones) that dot the country. These tours offer a deeper connection to Armenia’s rich traditions and artistic heritage.

types_of_tours.name: Custom & Private Tours
types_of_tours.description: Looking for something more personalized? We offer tailor-made tours to suit your interests and preferences. Whether it’s a romantic getaway, a family adventure, or a solo exploration, we can design a tour just for you.

types_of_tours.name: MICE and INCENTIVE
types_of_tours.description: We specialize in organizing MICE (Meetings, Incentives, Conferences, and Exhibitions) and Incentive Travel in Armenia. Whether it's a corporate meeting, team-building retreat, or large-scale conference, we provide unique venues, seamless logistics, and customized programs. Experience Armenia’s rich culture, breathtaking landscapes, and world-class hospitality,ensuring a successful and unforgettable event!

types_of_tours.name: FAMILY TOURS
types_of_tours.description: Create unforgettable memories with your loved ones on a family-friendly tour in Armenia! We offer safe, fun, and engaging itineraries tailored for all ages. Explore ancient landmarks, enjoy nature adventures, and experience authentic Armenian culture with hands-on activities. From scenic picnics to interactive museums, we ensure a stress-free and exciting journey for the whole family!

our_tours.call_text: Book your tour today and experience Armenia like never before!
